intro: Comesperma acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved comesperma, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. Comesperma acutifolium is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and arid conditions.
